headline: Lazygirl's Ground Turkey Stroganoff
description: This easy turkey stroganoff recipe features a creamy mixture of ground turkey and condensed cream of mushroom soup served over warm egg noodles.
name: Lazygirl's Ground Turkey Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rapid boil. Cook egg noodles at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, 7 to 9 minutes. Drain and keep warm.
While the noodles are cooking, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add turkey and onion; cook and stir until turkey is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in crumbled bouillon.

Whisk condensed soup and water together in a small bowl; pour into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with paprika and salt. Serve over warm egg noodles.

review.reviewBody: With a few suggested adjustments it came out very good.

I made this today for comfort food and I had ground turkey. I used a half fresh onion diced, salt, pepper, garlic powder and the paprika. Along with the cream of mushroom soup, I added a half can of celery soup because I opened it by accident and didn't want to waste it. Mixed it in with rotini. This is an easy when your home sick dish.

I made this as directed. It was not bad , but just OK . One review compared this dish to Hamburger Helper. I think that is accurate . Some found the paprica excessive, but I disagree, it merely added a bit of flavor, which this meal needed. It was still bland, and lacked richness. I did add black pepper at the table after tasting it , which improved the taste somewhat.
Easy and tasty. Better than the "helper" kits from the store.
This recipe was great but I followed one of the other reviews (Sara)and used sour cream as she did as well as added the garlic. My family loved it and asked when was I making it again! Huge WIN
It was AWESOME. My wife literally ate it every day for a week. I made it without the bullion since I didn't have any.
good but make sure not to put cream of chicken bc it tastes like chicken soup and dont coat the pan with almost a cup of oil and dont add a whole onion, then itll be good. good with jumbo shells

I usually agree with the allrecipe user rating, but this was a huge miss for me. I should have known - paprika & cream of mushroom soup as the only seasoning for ground turkey, a very bland meat? All I could smell was mushroom, and it turned out a weird pink color from the paprika. I'm sorry to say, it smelled awful to me & was barely edible, the tastes were so strange. Oddly enough my sister enjoyed it. To each their own...

LOVE any recipe that’s quick and easy. The name alone attracted me to it! Very flavorful. Also used Old Bay seasoning, black pepper, onion and garlic powders, soul seasoning, seasoned salt and a little chicken broth for the ground turkey. Turned out great!

This was VERY bland. Decided to try it again with adjustments...used beef bouillon, instead of chicken, added sour cream, worschestershire, salt and black pepper. It was MUCH better. More like beef stroganoff.
So quick and good!

I added garlic powder to the ground turkey while cooking it. Next time, I will add less paprika (which surprised me but we just didn't prefer that taste). Also added a couple tablespoons of Worchestershire and about 1/2 a cup of sour cream. I just dumped the noodles into the meat as we ended up having to wait a bit before we could eat. It held up well and we will make again.
This was good but it seemed to be missing something, added garlic to it and made it come out great. Will do this one again. Nice way to use ground turkey
Loved it. Might try it with sour cream next time.

Winner winner turkey dinner!! I was skeptical. I was lazy. I had a pound of turkey in the freezer I’d been trying to decide what to do with for awhile. Well, it was fast, easy, and husband, toddlers, grandpa, and I all loved it. I did add a teaspoon of chopped garlic when after sautéing the onion, and about 1/4 cup of sour cream at the end but I’m sure it would’ve been just as good without adding anything. I’ll probably be keeping the ingredients for this on hand for last minute dinner rescue. Takes about the same time as hamburger helper and tastes way better!
I added some light sour cream

The recipe calls for an insane amount of paprika!! The taste was so overpowering that I had to put a full block of cream cheese into tone it down and after that it was only tolerable. I won't be making this again.
My family was hesitant to try this, but everyone cleaned their plates! This is a keeper
so good. used gslic chopped and sauteed, thyme and paprika, chicken broth 1 cup, peas and sour cream on side, everone loved it even a 7 and 1 yr old
I loved this! I substituted 1 cup of sour cream for the condensed cream of mushroom soup, and I also added some minced garlic.
This was a good recipe, just need to give it a little bit more flavor.
My husband was diagnosed with Leukemia in Sept and we've been on lock down since then. I just made this recipe and we loved it. I would advise anyone wanting a quick and tasty meal to try this it.

When I try a new recipe, I make it exactly as written. I found it was kind of on the bland side, but it definitely has potential! Next time, I will use more onion, add garlic, and switch Cream of Mushroom with Cream of Chicken soup.

I made this today with 1/2 lb. of ground turkey. It's just me and hubby now. I didn't have any onion so I just seasoned with onion powder. I used smoked paprika. We really like seasonings so I added garlic powder, pepper & a no salt seasoning. Did not have enough egg noodles so I used linguine. It was very good. I will make it again, quick and easy.

This looked great in theory, being dairy free I was not able to add sour cream, but did every else thing else according to the recipe. I found the gravy to have very little flavour and the meatballs too much all spice flavour. Its possible that sour cream gives the gravy its flavour, but I felt like I was eating meatballs and noodles with margarine and parsley on it.

I'm sure adding sour cream makes it more flavorful, but I dont think I'll make this one again.

Love it!
Quick and delicious!
Yummy! Used a large can of mushroom soup; sautéed thinly sliced portobello mushrooms and 1/4 yellow onion before adding ground turkey. Easy weeknight dinner!
Good. A little too salty for me.
Simple and yummy! I added a few mushrooms I had on hand. Next time I will sauté the mushrooms and onions and then add to cooked meat.

This a fast and easy recipe, I added fresh portobello mushrooms, fresh garlic, fresh red onion, and instead of packaged noodles I made home made noodles, I’ve also made it the way it’s posted, both were delicious!
I always add sour cream

I doubled the recipe and used two teaspoons of Better than Bouillon to season the turkey and onion. I added salt and paprika at the end but it still came out fairly bland; I also added baby bella mushrooms and about 3/4 cup of sour cream to the mixture, as I was having trouble with it being excessively watery from the turkey and soup. I drained the water once but I think the next time after adding soup I might also add some flour to thicken the sauce.

I personal don’t like turkey but this recipe has become a household staple in this house! Kids don’t even realize they are eating turkey. I have made this on more then one occasion and I have added a cup of sour cream and two tablespoons of soy sauce! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!

I also put in sour cream and veggies. 
Great recipe 
Thank you
I added mushrooms and sauteed garlic(jarred) onion with ground chicken I needed to use. Used Campbell's Healthy Request Golden Mushroom soup and 2 tablespoons of light sour cream at the end. Yummy!!
Quick and easy. Stayed close to the exact recipe...just added some freshly ground black pepper and chili pepper flakes. Yum! On my 2nd serving I added some chopped green onions as topping.

Whoah, this was surprisingly good! I made the recipe mostly as it, but salted/peppered my ground turkey and added a little garlic powder and a pinch of red pepper. I served it over brown rice since that’s what I had. Definitely going in my easy, delicious weeknight meals recipe box!
I made this using leftover rotisserie chicken. It was pretty bland, but it was QUICK to make!
Good, quick meal. Added the 2 tablespoon of sour cream other than that all the same ingredients. Kids loved so that was a bonus. Will definitely make it again.
I added mushrooms and peas as it is a way to get my hubby too eat veggies. I also added an additional can of mushroom soup. Pretty good meal for such simple ingredients.

My family really liked it. I added 3 cloves of garlic and sliced fresh mushrooms. I also increased the onion to a medium onion finely diced, and used a full cup of chicken broth instead of water. I’ll definitely make it again.
I added bell pepper. Seasoning it with garlic and onion powder. Added a little ground black pepper.

While the turkey was browning I added about 1/2 teaspoon of beef BetterThanBoullion into the meat and juices, stirring thoroughly. I also used BetterThanBoullion dissolved into the 1/2 cup of added water, the result being a LazyGals Stroganoff.
One cup frozen diced onion and tablespoon of minced garlic, no bullion and it is great
Made this many times. Cooked a pork shoulder roast yesterday. Today ground leftovers and used it. Turned out great.
Really good
I added mushrooms and 1/4 cup of light sour cream. It was delicious. My family loved it. Definitely a keeper. And so quick to prepare.
Only did a few tweaks, used liquid chicken broth instead, and no paprika.
Hubby and I made this, and we thought it was quite tasty. We're making it again this week.
I think it’s great! Made it exactly as listed! Love it! ??
Very good! Nice and easy! I took the advice from other reviews and added peas sour cream and garlic. It came out great and thank you for the suggestions from reviewers!!
This was bland. i had to add more onion, and reheated adding Greek yogurt to give it some sour cream flavor.

Yes I made some changes, I added garlic powder and 8 oz of sliced mushroom and simmered it down for 2 hours and thickened it up with Wonder and served over broccoli instead of noodles and it was totally awesome!!! Loved it and I will totally make it again, my husband loved it!!!

It was a cold night in March and a snow storm was raging outside. I decided that stroganoff would be an excellent meal to have. Since we don’t eat beef, this recipe was a perfect choice and boy, was it delicious! The only change I made was using chicken broth instead of bullion. It made a thick, rich gravy that we all loved! I would definitely make this again. Yummo!!
I made this tonight because I had ground turkey meat and not much else. This was delicious! I added less water and less soup because of my sons texture issues. Very happy that I made it.
I make this every week!
yummy as is. i like mushrooms and onions so i added more but would have been delicious with or without
Good and quick. Added peas, swapped cream of mushroom for cream of chicken, and beef broth in exchange for water.
I made it the way it said and it just wasn't good.

I used dried minced onions instead of a real onion (in true lazy girl fashion) and I also added a dash of garlic powder. I did this as a meal prep lunch so I made enough for 4 servings and then stored it by serving amount in the fridge. Heats up well and definitely easy to make. Will make it again!

I omitted the oil because the turkey had enough fat for my liking. I also changed the 1/2 cup water for 1/2 cup low-fat sour cream (how can you have a proper stroganoff without sour cream?) and served it over rice (not a pasta fan). Simple, easy, and totally tasty!

Followed the recipe and just added 3/4 cup of frozen peas and 3/4 cup of French's Fried onions, and a little sprinkle of the onions on top for garnish.

Husband Loved it... Thank you.
Turned out great. I added chilli flakes and some extra garlic and a few other spices to kick it up a notch but it was great!

We really liked this! I'll def make it again. cooked turkey in one pan. cooked onions in a separate pan. combined the two. filled the onion pan with the needed amt of water and poured it into the mixture. I added canned mushrooms, too. Yummy!
We really hoped this would be great, but we didn't like it at all.
quick and delish! I used milk instead of water and added paprika and a bit of ground thyme because the color was way ugly.
It was great! I added peas, garlic, and a shallot.

I made a lot of changes. I caramelized an onion, added celery mushrooms and a red pepper. I only wanted the pepper for colour. Next time I will use peas. Also added Worcestershire sauce(1 tbls) some garlic and a tsp of Montreal chicken spice. After reading some of the other reviews I also used chicken stock instead of water. Turned out pretty good, the family ate it up:) Cheers to all.
Tasty, simple, and quick!

Four stars as is, five stars when enhanced with a diced onion and 3-4 minced garlic cloves sautéed with the meat and a cup of peas and a cup of sour cream added at the end. It could also use more color, maybe 1/4 cup of finely diced red bell pepper or pimentos, and maybe a few favorite herbs (for us rosemary and thyme). We'll definitely make this again - it was delicious!!

The only changes I made were cooking the onions after browning the turkey and sprinkling nutmeg on top at the end (just personal preferences). My husband and I both gobbled it down and agreed it was a "repeat". Thanks for sharing!

Easy, quick and easy to add alittle here and there to work with flavors. Being on a low sodium and low cholesterol diet, I added onion and garlic to my taste without the salt. I also used low sodium chicken broth in place of the bullion. Will definitely make again.

To make it less runny, I added 1/2 cup water with 2 heaping teaspoons of corn starch, whisked. I stirred in the cornstarch mixture with the Stroganoff when it was finished cooking. I let it thicken and It turned out great!
NO CHANGES AND MY FAMILY LOVED IT. This is an easy and fast recipe to make. I will be making this a monthly dinner.
My family loves this meal! So easy and very flavorful. I do add sour cream at the end for more creaminess. Kid favorite!

I have a couple of picky eaters in my household and this recipe has become a fave. Not only to I have to goad them to eat it, they come back for seconds and thirds... Amazing recipe that's so easy to make after working all day.

This recipe reminds me of a dish my grandmother made when I was a child. Its delicious. 
After making it a few times I altered the recipe slightly, I added 1 tsp Italian seasoning, 1/4 tsp garlic powder, 2 tbs cream cheese and ommited the paprika. 
My family loves this recipe and its quick and easy. Two thumbs way up ???
I will not make again. It did not taste like regular recipe that I am used to.

I gave it 4 starts but it could have easily been fine. I read several reviews and used broth instead of water and chicken bullion. I also added about 2/3 cups of sour cream. My whole family ate it. My kids won't touch anything that has onions in it and they loved it. My picky daughter had seconds. Great Recipe!

Today was uncle day care lol glad i came across this jewel. Added chicken broth in place of water plus two garlic cloves & whole kernel corn. sprinkled monterey jack cheese before throwing in the oven on 350 so cheese could melt. we all enjoyed the meal!
Tasty, but a little dry.
It was better than the hamburger helper...it was okay...

Came out great, just added 1/4 cup of chopped canned mushrooms, 1/4 cup all together green yellow and red chopped peppers. I swapped out bone broth as a replacement for the water, added 1/2 cup sour cream and 1 tablespoon of dried parsley flakes Served it with peas on the side. Was a hit in my house I will be making this again.
I Love this recipe. I just added a little extra cream of chicken and because I didn't have chicken bouillon I used beef. It came out so awesome. I would make this again in a heartbeat!

Today I prepared for you a Creamy Shiitake Mushroom Turkey Stroganoff and Tomato-Spinach Rotini. I didn't have any Mushroom soup so I made some using freeze dried shiitake and made a roux cream from scratch. I used the water that the mushrooms seeped in, added an (extra ) chicken bouillon cube to it and mixed the mushroom-chicken brine into the roux and continued to add milk, garlic, salt and pepper. I glazed the pan with butter and fresh chopped garlic and added 2/3 cup of onion (instead of a tablespoon) to a pound of turkey and browned it really well while the roux thickened. Dont be afraid to brown the turkey well because once it goes into the roux it will absorb a lot. These methods injected flavor into the dish and given turkey burger is notorious for being dry and tasteless -- I impressed myself. Yum-yum.
Super easy and the family loved it. Served it with cornbread.
Yum!! Really simple, yields a lot, great as leftovers! I added mushrooms and used less water. Might use mushrooms cut out the water entirely next time and see how that goes.
The only changes I made were beef boulllion and adding sour cream and omitting the paprika (based on the reviews). This was so easy and quick, and tasted good even before adding the sour cream.
Can't stop making this recipe! Added garlic and chili powder for an extra spark!
This was a major disappointment. Won't be making this again

This was a great, quick meal! I did make some changes based on the other comments...

Changes I made:
Added mushrooms
Salt and Pepper the meat
Added Garlic
Used Chicken Broth instead of water

Def. will make again!
It was a little bland. I added 1 clove of garlic, poultry seasoning, and red pepper flakes. I also, used cream instead of water. Family enjoyed it.
I added more mushrooms
This came out really good! Emmmmm. :) I changed it up a little. I added a table spoon of minced garlic, 1/2 extra can of cream of mushroom soup, 1 pack of fresh mushroom.

3 stars as written, but I made some changes that other suggested and it is now a favorite. First, I brown the turkey with 2 cloves garlic, then set it aside. I then cook about 8 oz fresh brown mushrooms sliced or quartered (done it both ways, up to preference) with 1/2 an onion diced thin, along with 2 more cloves of garlic until the mushrooms start to brown and the onion is soft. I then add the turkey back, add the soup, add 2 tbls of sour cream, a dash of milk or cream, dash of paprika, black pepper, and salt to taste (depending on the soup used, may not need to add any salt). My wife loves it, as does my son!

The first time I made this recipe it was a little bland, so I made a few additions. I added a tablespoon of minced garlic and a tablespoon of Ms. Dash to the ground turkey. Once the mixture is brown I added an 8 oz. package of cream cheese and an 8 oz. container of sour cream. These changes made the dish creamy and delicious!
Even the picky teenager loved it!! Super quick and easy and very yummy.
Quick & Easy dinner! We gobbled it up.

Made this for my son's lunch. I wanted to try something different and simple. It was quick. I added red pepper, garlic powder, and a little salt to the ground turkey. Drained it and added only a half can of water. Season my noodles with butter and garlic and parsley salt mix. It taste great! Not bland at all.
